questions.question: What is Java?
questions.details: Java is the high-level, object-oriented, robust, secure programming language, platform-independent, high performance, Multithreading, and portable programming language. It was developed by James Gosling in June 1991.
questions.shortAns: It is a high-level, object-oriented, secure programming language.

questions.question: What is a Java Virtual Machine?
questions.details: It is an abstract machine which provides the runtime environment in which Java bytecode can be executed. It is a specification which specifies the working of Java Virtual Machine.
questions.shortAns: It is an abstract machine that acts like a run-time engine which calls the main method present in the Java code.

questions.question: What is a Higher Order Function?
questions.details: The result of one higher-order function can be used as the input to another higher-order function. Any time we pass a lambda expression to a method, that method is a higher-order function.
questions.shortAns: It is a function that either accept other functions as arguments, or return a function as a result.

questions.question: What is an .equals() method in Java?
questions.details: The (==) equals operator used to compare the equality of the values. But in the terms of object-oriented programming, to deal with the values in the form of objects. And this object may contain multiple types of data. So using the (==) operator does not work with this case. So we need to go with the .equals() method.
questions.shortAns: it is used to compare objects.

questions.question: Do final, finally and finalize keywords have the same function?
In an instance method or a constructor, 'this' is a reference to the current object?
questions.details: this keyword refers to the current object in a method or constructor and helps to eliminate the confusion between class attributes and parameters with the same name

questions.question: Constructor overloading is not possible in Java?
questions.details: Java supports constructor overloading. Overloaded constructor is called based upon the parameters specified when new is executed.

questions.question: Java programming is not statically-typed, means all variables need not first be declared before they can be used.
questions.details: Every variable in java needs to be declared first before use, else it throws compilation error

questions.question: What is a wrapper class?
questions.details: A wrapper class converts a primitive type into an object. An example would be the Integer class.
questions.shortAns: It is used to turn a primitive into an object

questions.question: When an array is passed to a method, what does the method receive?
questions.details: When an array is passed to a method, a reference of the array is received by the method.
questions.shortAns: It is the reference of the array.

questions.question: Java supports multiple inheritance
questions.details: One class cannot inherit multiple classes. We can simulate this by implementing multiple interfaces.

questions.question: compareTo() returns?
questions.details: compareTo() returns an int value.

questions.question: Where does the system stores parameters and local variables whenever a method is invoked?
questions.details: The system stores parameters and local vaiables in stack in java.

questions.question: String is a mutable Datatype
questions.details: String is an immutable datatype

questions.question: What does the 'synchronized' keyword do?
questions.details: 'synchronized' isolates a thread so that other threads using the same resource(s) cannot interrupt it.
questions.shortAns: It is used to isolate a thread.

questions.question: What are Access Modifiers?
questions.details: The access modifiers in Java specifies the accessibility or scope of a field, method, constructor, or class.
questions.shortAns: It is used to specify accessibility of classes

questions.question: What is an Exception?
questions.details: An Exception is a problem that can occur during the normal flow of execution of a program.
questions.shortAns: It is a problem that occur during runtime and compile time.

questions.question: What is an Error?
questions.details: An irrecoverable state of the system is caused by an error while the system goes to a recoverable state when an exception is thrown.
questions.shortAns: It is a problem that mostly arises due to the shortage of system resources

questions.question: Does java uses inheritance?
questions.details: Inheritance is an important pillar of OOP(Object-Oriented Programming). It is the mechanism in java by which one class is allowed to inherit the features(fields and methods) of another class.

questions.question: Garbage collection is manual process.
questions.details: Java garbage collection is an automatic process.

questions.question: Is null a keyword in java?
questions.details: Null is a reserved keyword in the Java programming language. It's technically an object literal similar to True or False.
